title: Technical programme and best paper award update

moderator: James G. Shanahan, Church and Duncan Group, Inc.

segmentation: Following a glare Kojak's fault arose quick.
I see WSM 2012, tonar sermon, Vachon of Good morning everybody.
That was an Irish greeting there.
We still speak Irish in Ireland by the way.
So if you want to learn some Irish over next few days by all means indulge.
Anne, my name is Jimi Shanahan and I'm the program Co chair for ICD 1020 twelve.
I'm here with Nicole Ellison and Xenopus, somewhere floating around as well I believe and we were the program Co chairs for this year.
We have a very exciting educational and entertaining technical program this year in store for you over the next three days.
And as.
Former kick off this conference.
There are some interesting facts about the conference we'd like to share with you.
We had a fantastic submission level again this year.
In fact, we increased the number of submissions by 10% over last year.
Submissions, all null.
We had about 270 submissions, and here is the keyword cloud of the submitted papers now after Nick.
Call Zainab myself.
We're done with this.
We whittled it down to a more compact cloud where the emphasis changed a little bit and we have the usual suspects there.
But in addition, we have some representation from concepts such as privacy, education, diffusion, location based disease, and so on.
So.

Looking more closely at the submitted papers we had about, we had 232 full paper submissions, 34 posters and eight demos, and from a presentation perspective this year, like previous years, we wanted to keep this conference as a single track conference.
To maintain this, we decided to keep the new track that we introduced last year.
The full paper lightning track.
And we have three lighting sessions, one of which will have today at 12:10 and tomorrow and Thursday.

So overall we selected 20 full papers for all presentation and 27 papers for Lightning presentation and that gives us an overall acceptance rate of 20% and that was pretty aggressive compared to last year's 24% acceptance rate.
In addition, we accepted 67 posters from all submissions and three demos.
So if we look.
Back over the last four or five years, we can see some steady growth in terms of paper submissions, and if we squint a little bit and use a little bit of imagination, which is, I think, ambitious.
At this hour of the morning.

I guess for most of us we can see a hockey stick curve growth and let me tell you, in the business world, and so certainly in Silicon Valley, where I hang out these days this up into the right curve is very desirable.
Now if this trend continues, will surely lead to a very successful future for this conference.
So looking more closely at the distribution of accepted papers, we see papers coming from all over the world.
Asia, South America, North America, Europe, with the US being a very dominant force in this conference.
So overall we had 47 accepted full papers.
And at this point I would like to thank the paper and poster authors along with the demo providers for giving us such a rich, diverse and provocative program.
So please put your hands together and join me in thanking these wonderful authors.
So John has already been.
Service, but I thought I'd just give you a breakdown.
The numbers and Teddy where people are coming from.
Again, we're getting people from all over the world.
We have approximately 330 people at the latest tally and this represents a fabless increase over last year's attendees.
We've got about 25% increase and I think John has done a great job here in getting this conference off the ground and having so many people here from all over the world.
So I think congratulations to John and the team for fabulous job.
So let's join.
So in addition to a.
Fantastic organizing committee that we've already seen.
We had a team of 22 senior PC members and Needless to say their efforts were Herculean in nature.
And again, I'd like you to join me in.
Thanking them.
Please put your hands together.
And if they say we had an army of PC members 129 and once again I want to give them a big thank you.
Now, John mentioned earlier that we have student volunteers here and we have a large staff of student volunteers who are supporting this conference.
So student volunteers.
I think you should stand and make yourselves known we have this fantastic.
Why teachers?
These are just a small subset of the volunteers.
Sorry, we have more details.
About how we're going to select the best paper and best poster paper, but will share those with you later.
And we'll also share some more details about the Lightning sessions as well in due course.
So I'd like John and Nicole Ansina pattern famous floating around somewhere.
To join me here.
And to say that without further ado, it is our distinct and the pleasure to declare this conference open and ready for business and welcome and have a great conference.
